Package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace

Class BradfordAdaptation

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.BradfordAdaptation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChromaticAdaptation
    public class BradfordAdaptation
extends Object
implements ChromaticAdaptation

    This class represents a linear chromatic adaptation transform, mapping XYZ color coordinates from a source white (reference) point to a target white point. Both white points are passed to the constructor. The actual color mapping is done by method applyTo(float[]). The underlying linear transformation is specified by matrix 'Mcat', which may be retrieved by getMcat()). See the Section 14.6 of [1] for additional details and examples.

    [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).

    • Method Detail

      • applyTo

        public float[] applyTo​(float[] xyz)
        Description copied from interface: ChromaticAdaptation
        Transforms the specified XYZ source color coordinates to target coordinates. The specified color coordinates are interpreted relative to (source) white point (W1). Returns a new color adapted to (target) white point W2.
        Specified by:
        applyTo in interface ChromaticAdaptation
        Parameters:
        xyz - the original color point w.r.t. W1
        Returns:
        the associated color w.r.t. the target white point (W2).

      • getMcat

        public double[][] getMcat()
        Returns the color adaptation transformation matrix (Mcat).
        Returns:
        the color adaptation transformation matrix
